boardgame.name: Eggs and Empires
boardgame.description: Eggs from the dragons of Ridback Mountain are valuable _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;mdash; not quite as valuable as gold following the last market fluctuation, but still TOTALLY worth the hassle, especially since it's not like YOU are climbing the mountain and searching through dragon caves. That's what peasants are for..._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;All the empires have sent their intrepid adventurers out to collect eggs, but not all will succeed! It gets crowded on Ridback Mountain, and there are only so many dragon eggs to go around _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;mdash; not to mention that the dragons have started mixing exploding eggs into their nests, and those hurt._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;In the fast-playing card game Eggs and Empires, players use matching decks of empire cards that contain adventurers numbered 1-10. Starting with a hand of three empire cards, each turn all players select one card from their hand, then play them simultaneously in an attempt to collect egg cards. Typically, the player who played the highest empire card chooses an egg first, then the player with the second highest empire card, and so on until all revealed eggs are collected, if possible. However, each empire card has a unique power that can affect the order in which eggs are selected. The powers interact in strategic and awesome ways so that every hand is exciting and fun!_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Outwit your opponents to collect as many good eggs as possible _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;mdash; that is, ones worth victory points (VPs) _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;mdash; while avoiding those nasty exploding eggs! Whoever collects the most VPs over three rounds wins._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Eggs and Empires: U-Turn Promo Card
boardgame.boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 76-- Spiel des Jahres chat and What we have been playing With guests Joel Eddy and Paul Owen
The Game of Crowd Funding Ben Pinchback and Matt Riddle Interview 04-25-2014
The Long View: Princes of Florence
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 33

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes: Gryphon Games (GRY101454N) Eggs from the dragons of Ridback Mountain are valuable - not quite as valuable as gold following the last market fluctuation, but still TOTALLY worth the hassle, especially since it_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s not like YOU are climbing the mountain and searching through dragon caves. That_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s what peasants are for... All the empires have sent their intrepid Adventurers out to collect Eggs, but not all will succeed! It gets crowded on Ridback Mountain, and there are only so many dragon Eggs to go around - not to mention that the dragons have started mixing Exploding Eggs into their nests, and those hurt. Eggs and Empires is a fast-playing card game in which players will use matching decks of Empire Cards that contain Adventurers numbered 1-10. On each turn, all players will select one card from their hand and play it simultaneously in an attempt to collect Good Eggs that are worth VP while avoiding the nasty Exploding Eggs that lose VP! Typically, the player who played the highest Adventurer chooses an Egg first, then the player with the second highest Adventurer picks an Egg, and so on until all revealed Eggs are collected. Ah, but it_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s not that simple! Each Adventurer has a unique power that can affect the order in which Eggs are selected. The powers interact in strategic and awesome ways so that every hand is exciting and different. Outwit your opponents to collect as many Dragon Eggs as possible - while avoiding those wicked Exploding Eggs!

Gryphon Games (GRY101454N) Eggs from the dragons of Ridback Mountain are valuable - not quite as valuable as gold following the last market fluctuation, but still TOTALLY worth the hassle, especially since it_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s not like YOU are climbing the mountain and searching through dragon caves. That_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s what peasants are for... All the empires have sent their intrepid Adventurers out to collect Eggs, but not all will succeed! It gets crowded on Ridback Mountain, and there are only so many dragon Eggs to go around - not to mention that the dragons have started mixing Exploding Eggs into their nests, and those hurt. Eggs and Empires is a fast-playing card game in which players will use matching decks of Empire Cards that contain Adventurers numbered 1-10. On each turn, all players will select one card from their hand and play it simultaneously in an attempt to collect Good Eggs that are worth VP while avoiding the nasty Exploding Eggs that lose VP! Typically, the player who played the highest Adventurer chooses an Egg first, then the player with the second highest Adventurer picks an Egg, and so on until all revealed Eggs are collected. Ah, but it_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s not that simple! Each Adventurer has a unique power that can affect the order in which Eggs are selected. The powers interact in strategic and awesome ways so that every hand is exciting and different. Outwit your opponents to collect as many Dragon Eggs as possible - while avoiding those wicked Exploding Eggs!
Kickstarter edition. Played once, excellent condition.
Brand new in wrapping from Kickstarter!! Includes KS bonuses - expansions. Cheap shipping, please let me know if you have any questions!!
